title: y11051
author: y11051
content: Hello, I am a new coiner living in Korea. I want to make some money on the coin market, but I heard that the BnB Tiger coin has risen tremendously. A whopping 50 million percent... So I wanted to find a similar coin, but there was no information and I couldn't search on the Korean site, so I had to use Google Translate and post a question on this site.I'm curious about the coin with the most views currently, which is a similar meme to the BnB Tiger coin. Not Pepecoin or Dogecoin...

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: If you mean this token BNB Tiger, what makes you think it grew by a "whopping 50 million percent"? The token appeared quite recently and its ATH is only a little less than 100%. Or it's just another PR for no one's unnecessary shitcoin. Plus, it says that "According to GoPlus, the contract creator can make changes to the token contract such as disabling sells, changing fees, minting, transferring tokens etc. Exercise caution." Which proves that this shitcoin was created just to make money from naive people who think they were provided with gem

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Xal0lex on October 29, 2023, 11:23:57 AMThe contract creator can make changes to the token contract such as disabling sells, changing fees, minting, transferring tokens etc. Exercise caution." Which proves that this shitcoin was created just to make money from naive people who think they were provided with gem Well if this the case then its a red flag. If someone playing shitcoin then the first thing they need to secure is the contract is safe and solid. Use tools to check first cause if ever theres a pump and many bots rushes to buy it if you cant sell it then you arent gaining at all. Ive seen a lot of projects like this with a huge pump but cant sell so its worthless at all.

comments.author: Tytanowy Janusz
comments.body: Quote from: y11051 on October 29, 2023, 10:14:04 AMI'm curious about the coin with the most views currently, which is a similar meme to the BnB Tiger coin. Not Pepecoin or Dogecoin...If you are looking for a project like BNB Tiger, i.e. a project with no utility and just a name, with a fraudulent smart contract full of red flags, which may end in a rugpull at any time, then don't waste your time looking. Buy the first meme coin you find out of 1000's that are created every day (and 999 goes to zero next day). You'll lose your wallet anyway. At least you'll save time on "research".

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: Quote from: Xal0lex on October 29, 2023, 11:23:57 AMIf you mean this token BNB Tiger, what makes you think it grew by a "whopping 50 million percent"? The token appeared quite recently and its ATH is only a little less than 100%. Or it's just another PR for no one's unnecessary shitcoin. Plus, it says that "According to GoPlus, the contract creator can make changes to the token contract such as disabling sells, changing fees, minting, transferring tokens etc. Exercise caution." Which proves that this shitcoin was created just to make money from naive people who think they were provided with gem Wow...thanks for exposing just another very, very risky proposition. I am sure OP is  just here to promote the said token so they can be able to gain more buying supporters. I am more concerned with newbies who are enticed into this risky industry all thinking they can one day be a millionaire only to find out they are duped. Of course, sometimes we can only blamed them for not researching enough and not doing due diligence. We do live in a world of Artificial Intelligence but also artificial or rather fake offers.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Don't believe in such kind of market. This kind of thing will obviously make you cry in the end. And, if you are looking for a get-rich-quick scheme then I doubt there's anything in existence. Why do you think that you can achieve that in cryptocurrencies? It's all just fake news.Manipulating the market has happened before, someone will fake buy a token and then make it in the trend but I tell you it won't last long because only those who are manipulating it will end up rich and not you. They want you to invest in it to take your money and not give you anything in return. Don't be fooled by those types of tokens because it already happened before during the ICO days. Look for a legitimate, reputable, and trusted project instead of this. You will just waste your time, effort, and money by being fooled by them. Try to think again, who will give you such a huge amount in such a short time? It cannot happen or this world's financial industry will be doomed.

I want to make some money on the coin market, but I heard that the BnB Tiger coin has risen tremendously. A whopping 50 million percent... So I wanted to find a similar coin, but there was no information and I couldn't search on the Korean site, so I had to use Google Translate and post a question on this site.I'm curious about the coin with the most views currently, which is a similar meme to the BnB Tiger coin. Not Pepecoin or Dogecoin...Is it Binance tiger? where's the lion ?    Not sure if this is a legit post or just like what some new account does that created thread mentioning some projects name and leave it there .I will only give importance here if OP comes back and answer the first post giving that project is questionable about the creators rights to what His power can command him and may result investors losses .

comments.author: kizlod
comments.body: Every memecoins is similar to each other. They have no utility and were made to rip-off other memecoins. I'd recommend just to do research and find something better than memecoins to invest in.

comments.author: oktana
comments.body: If you want to invest in something, do it because you want to invest and not because you're pressured to. I also want my investments to increase by 50 million percent too, however, I am not blinded by what others have done. FOMO can do a lot of damage though (impulsive decision-making, rushing without doing proper research, lack of focus, etc), I've seen it ruin people's lives over the past few years. Also, be careful about what you invest into, a couple of projects fake their pump just to get investors (who probably then become unlucky).

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: going in search of the next meme token that is worth a lot is nothing more or less like... playing at the casino! I Will not call investment unless behind there Is a certain use case, big community and so on...ok there have been cases of large increases even for coins that practically had no value initially. but this is not always the case, in fact this is the smallest part of what is actually successful. everything else are real scams and nothing more.

comments.author: Bushdark
comments.body: Quote from: y11051 on October 29, 2023, 10:14:04 AMHello, I am a new coiner living in Korea. I want to make some money on the coin market, but I heard that the BnB Tiger coin has risen tremendously. A whopping 50 million percent... So I wanted to find a similar coin, but there was no information and I couldn't search on the Korean site, so I had to use Google Translate and post a question on this site.I'm curious about the coin with the most views currently, which is a similar meme to the BnB Tiger coin. Not Pepecoin or Dogecoin...If you want to make good profits from meme coins then you must be ready to do research because this is what will aid you to understand and know what coin you will have to invest in that would give you good profits. Crypto market is very risky and we need to understand some of the precautions we need to take that will prevent us from getting scammed or investing in a project that would end up to become a rug pull. There are projects that had crashed and made investors to lose there hard earned money because they were not able to see the risks attached to altcoins investments.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Quote from: Xal0lex on October 29, 2023, 11:23:57 AMIf you mean this token BNB Tiger, what makes you think it grew by a "whopping 50 million percent"? The token appeared quite recently and its ATH is only a little less than 100%. Or it's just another PR for no one's unnecessary shitcoin. Plus, it says that "According to GoPlus, the contract creator can make changes to the token contract such as disabling sells, changing fees, minting, transferring tokens etc. Exercise caution." Which proves that this shitcoin was created just to make money from naive people who think they were provided with gem In short, you buy that shitcoin but you own anything, with such permissions, this token is worse than buying it from CEX, and you need complete trust in the owners of the contract, who may be unknown or difficult to track down judicially.The rise in price by 50 million is unreal, it may be 500% or 5 times the bottom, but sometimes such tokens set an initial price of 0.0000001 so that reaching a dollar (after burning most of the tokens) is as if it is an increase of a million%.

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: everyones looking for memeshitcoin already hoping for it to be the next SHIB. so far there are tons of it flooding the market in all platforms.Eth i think has the most of these meme coins. the newest is not bnb tiger afaik, its Memecoin which was released in binance launchpad few days ago. thats the name that you can expect for its usecase.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: There isn't such legit increasements in price, even in cryptocurrency market. When you see people promising huge profitability like a zillion percent, you can be assured it's a scam scheme aiming to steal money from naive and greedy investors who don't have any clue about what they are doing with their funds. If you want to make profit in crypto market you have to be patient and expect realistic results from your investments. Sometimes it can take up to few years until you see some considerable profit coming in. Meanwhile, you have to hold your coins safely, so make sure to buy cryptocurrencies which have long term potential and forget about the short term ones, which are mostly scams.

comments.author: $crypto$
comments.body: 50 million percent is not wrong.   I don't think there is an increase in meme coins to millions of percent I just realized now that you said it. Lol - you know how many people have said that meme coins are full of risks and losing them is 90% certain? I won't give you any meme coins because I don't want to lead you to the wrong shitcoin.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: y11051 on October 29, 2023, 10:14:04 AM...I'm curious about the coin with the most views currently, which is a similar meme to the BnB Tiger coin. Not Pepecoin or Dogecoin...I can tell you a coin around which a HYPE has been created in recent days - this is the $Meme coin. But the profit will be received by those who bought this coin on sale, and not by those who will buy it on the exchange from them. Accordingly, buying a coin on the pump, you will definitely lose your money.

comments.author: wxa7115
comments.body: Quote from: $crypto$ on November 01, 2023, 04:31:28 PM50 million percent is not wrong.   I don't think there is an increase in meme coins to millions of percent I just realized now that you said it. Lol - you know how many people have said that meme coins are full of risks and losing them is 90% certain? I won't give you any meme coins because I don't want to lead you to the wrong shitcoin.Those people promoting their shitcoins are getting more and more shameless by the day, 50 million percent of growth is something that only bitcoin achieved, and that is only true because its starting price was so low on the early days.So it is basically impossible for a shitcoin to reach such a high growth, and we can safely ignore the post of the OP as just a lame and useless attempt to promote their own coin.

comments.author: tygeade
comments.body: Quote from: kizlod on October 31, 2023, 05:43:46 AMEvery memecoins is similar to each other. They have no utility and were made to rip-off other memecoins. I'd recommend just to do research and find something better than memecoins to invest in.Maybe those who are a complete scam and have died out already have no utility but for those popular meme coins that are also at the top e.g DOGE and SHIB, their utility must be for payment use or a currency. I already heard some meme coins who have their own exchange and their token can function something like a BNB inside it. This must be another example of utility. All meme coins might still be the same, in a way that they are tagged like this (a meme coin).So, even if some has a utility, many people might still not be convinced on them. This is where I agree with you that it's better to find something better than a meme coin. There were also lot's of them.
